Dear Ms. Hinton:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
7/11/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record must contain all the following
information before employment may occur:
(h) Documentation from the department that the person
has not been named in a central registry case as the
perpetrator of child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in
any state where the person lived in the 5 years
preceding hire.
One of one new employee records reviewed showed the employee had lived in
Seattle, Washington within the last five years and the record did not show
documentation of out-of-state child abuse clearance conducted and received by the
agency prior to the employee's 8/21/2023 date of hire.
The employee is a licensed foster parent with another child placing agency and the
Guidance Center showed documentation of a cleared Washington state child abuse
clearance received on 10/7/2023, conducted by the employee's licensing agency.
CPA Rule 400.12214 Compliance with the child protection law.
(1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
One of one new employee records reviewed did not show documentation of a
children protective service history review by the licensing department for the
2

employee prior to the employee’s 8/21/2023 date of hire. One was requested and
received by the agency on 7/11/20232024.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months
after the staff member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a written
evaluation must be conducted every 12 months.
One of four employee records reviewed showed the employee's annual
performance evaluation was due by 2/21/2024 and completed late on 4/25/2024.
CPA Rule 400.12202 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for all the areas of foster care services as
provided in R400.12203 to R 400.12214.
The agency requires annual CPS and criminal history clearances for all its
employees as a way to maintain compliance with staff qualification rules.
Two of four employee records reviewed showed:
• One employee’s annual CPS clearance was due by 8/16/2023 and
completed late on 8/30/2023.
• A second employee's annual CPS clearance was due by 8/9/2023 and
completed late on 9/20/2023.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request.
(3) An agency shall provide the licensee an application
for renewal of the license and document the action not
less than 60 calendar days before the expiration date of
the license. A renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending recommendation for
disciplinary action of the license.
Two of three open foster home records reviewed showed the respective foster home
was not provided an application within 60 days of the respective foster home's
license expiration date.
3

CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household must have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
and cardiopulmonary resuscitation from the American
Heart Association or the American Red Cross, or other
institution approved by the department.
One of three open foster home records reviewed showed the foster parent’s CPR
and first aid certification expired 2/17/2024 and was not renewed until 3/5/2024.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster
home license.
One of three open foster home records reviewed showed the agency's reevaluation
of the foster home dated 1/23/2024; and its recommendation to the department on
1/26/2024 were not at least 15 days prior to the foster home's 2/5/2024 license
expiration date.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all the
following information:
(c) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names may not be included in the
report.
One of one special evaluation records reviewed did not show documentation of all
persons interviewed or what they reported.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that the foster
parent has a right to have his or her written response
included as an attachment to the report required by
subrule (5) of this rule.
In one of one special evaluation records reviewed the record did not show
documentation of (b) as required by the rule.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• R400.12234(b) Revaluation: The agency was apprised the reevaluation
report shall consistently and clearly indicate what the foster parent reports
as their strengths and weaknesses, and what was reported by each
household member when interviewed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• R400.12306(3) Application request: The agency was advised indicating
that the application is attached as a statement in the letter that it sends to
the foster parent related to the family’s upcoming renewal inspection may
aid it in showing clearer compliance to this rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator's report dated 7/5/2024. The agency
was in full compliance of the rules during its 2023 renewal inspection. The chief
administrator reports the agency is working to secure more foster homes. The
agency’s licensing supervisor reported the same, and that it has been a struggle,
but that they are further along now.
The agency acknowledged that its increase in rule noncompliance this year is
likely due to them having more foster homes, and the staff continuing to learn as
more is required to be known and illustrated/clearly documented. They vow to
improve rule compliance by the next inspection, and to work for full compliance of
all rules.
Financial Overview
5

The agency submitted a 2024 budget and 9/30/2023 independent financial audit.
A review of these documents did not show any concerns.
Staff and Youth Interviews
In addition to a discussion with the chief administrator and licensing supervisor,
during the entrance conference, and speaking separately with the licensing
supervisor; I interviewed the licensing worker.
Those interviewed reported the agency being community oriented, a good place to
work, and this program being for a good cause. No concerns were indicated by
the staff, and funding to recruit more foster families was reported as an area of
need.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility was conducted. The agency has sufficient space and
equipment for its staff, and files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This is not a contract agency.
RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
